summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors discussing a draft letter to Judge Nathan regarding the unsealing of materials in the Epstein case. The prosecutors debate who should sign the letter and the strategy for opposing attempts to circumvent a recent protective order.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The federal judge overseeing the case to whom the draft letter regarding unsealing materials is addressed.

events.title: Drafting of Letter to Judge Nathan
events.description: Prosecutors draft and discuss a letter to Judge Nathan opposing attempts to unseal materials, arguing there is no good cause to circumvent a protective order entered less than a month prior.

keyFacts: Prosecutors are drafting a letter to Judge Nathan to oppose unsealing materials in the Epstein case.
The prosecutors argue there is 'no good cause' to circumvent a protective order that was entered less than a month prior.
The email discusses strategic considerations, including whether to get into detailed accusations or keep arguments at a 'level of abstraction'.
There is internal discussion about which prosecutor should formally sign and file the letter due to concerns about being 'formally not on the case'.
